alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lehigh and Carbon Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Christmans, or 12 miles north of Lehighton, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lehighton, Palmerton, Jim Thorpe, Nesquehoning, Weatherly, New Mahoning, Beltzville State Park, Albrightsville, Emerald, Christmans, Meckesville, Lake Harmony, Lansford, Summit Hill, Bowmanstown, Parryville, Weissport and Weissport East. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 69 and 97. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 282. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
